Text: FPL Energys Initial Brief in PUCT Docket No Protocolsis FPL Energys Initial Brief Microsoft Word format in Docket No As noted in the certificate of service the attached brief has also been delivered by mail to all parties FPL ENERGY BRIEFdoc

EL CONFIDENTIALTFG Tabors Hydropower TestimonyAt the request of the TFG Steering Committee we are circulating the testimony prepared by Richard Tabors that Powerex plans to submit regarding the special features of hydropower systems and their role in the PNW This is testimony that the TFG or a number of its members may wish to support or refer to at hearing The text is a slightly modified version of what Powerex filed at the July hearing in the settlement conferences before Judge Wagner We will be circulating Richards draft testimony on economic issues later this afternoon for TFG review Also please be advised that the Steering Committee suggests that Ripple Claim testimony that TFG members may file individually contain an aggregate gross refund number and refer to the number of sellers who would be responsible for the refunds To keep peace in the family the Steering Committee recommends that individual sellers with refund responsibility NOT be named Since this testimony will not be admitted into evidence and will not be subject to cross but will be placed in the record as an offer of proof the Steering Committee believes that work papers need not be supplied So the identities of the first wave Ripple Claim respondents need not be revealed under this approach Please be advised that Powerex intends to submit its Ripple Claim testimony on the basis recommended by the Steering Committee Deanna King Bracewell Patterson LLP CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE This email and any attachments are for the exclusive and confidential use of the intended recipient If you are not the intended recipient please do not read distribute or take action in reliance upon this message If you have received this in error please notify us immediately by return email and promptly delete this message and its attachment from your computer system We do not waive attorneyclient or work product privilege by the transmission of this message

EL CONFIDENTIAL TFG Tabors Direct Testimony and ExhibitsAttached is the direct testimony of Richard Tabors along with two exhibits Comments should be received no later than PM EST on Sunday August All comments and suggestions need to be in writing and can be faxed not Emailed to Dan Watkiss at Also if your suggestion is a proposed addition please write out the exact language you would propose we incorporate into the testimony and where you would place the addition One final note on a separate topic A number of parties have expressed concern about submitting work papers and other supporting evidence with respect to ripple claims The TFG Steering Committee has suggested to its members that ripple claim testimony contain aggregate refund numbers instead of naming individual sellers at this stage in the proceeding By filing supporting documents which identify specific sellers even if made confidential under the protective order for all our transactions in the refund exposure period group members will essentially be releasing much of the information that was originally placed only in the hands of the Judge and FERC staff As noted in an earlier email Dan Watkiss will be seeking approval of Judge Cintron to allow parties to file supporting evidence of ripple claims under seal to FERC staff and to the Judge CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE This email and any attachments are for the exclusive and confidential use of the intended recipient If you are not the intended recipient please do not read distribute or take action in reliance upon this message If you have received this in error please notify us immediately by return email and promptly delete this message and its attachment from your computer system We do not waive attorneyclient or work product privilege by the transmission of this message RDT Testimony on pdf exhibit RDTpdf Exhibit RDTpdf
